channel.title: Posts on Ella's Data Science Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ella's Data Science Blog

item.title: Histograms
item.author: edipie09@lakers.mercyhurst.edu (Ella DiPietro)
item.description: Here’s another way to visualize data from the Lahmans Baseball Data Base. Again, we’ll need to bring in the tools with library: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) We want to see the weight distribution of baseball players, so let’s pull that data from Lahman’s Master Table and store the result of the query for later use: query<-“SELECT weight FROM Master” sqldf(query) result<-sqldf(query) Now, lets visualize the distibution in a Histogram. We’ll use ggplot again for this:

item.title: Scatter Plots
item.author: edipie09@lakers.mercyhurst.edu (Ella DiPietro)
item.description: For our first post, we will create scatter plots using information from the Lahman’s Baseball database. First, we will need to download some packages and bring them in: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Now, we can use these tools to find the homerun and strikout totals for players who have hit more than 400 homeruns. We will store the result of our query for use later: query<-"SELECT playerID,sum(HR) AS career_HR,sum(SO) AS career_SO FROM Batting GROUP BY playerID HAVING sum(HR)>=400" sqldf(query) ## playerID career_HR career_SO ## 1 aaronha01 755 1383 ## 2 bagweje01 449 1558 ## 3 bankser01 512 1236 ## 4 beltrad01 445 1584 ## 5 beltrca01 421 1693 ## 6 bondsba01 762 1539 ## 7 cabremi01 446 1516 ## 8 cansejo01 462 1942 ## 9 dawsoan01 438 1509 ## 10 delgaca01 473 1745 ## 11 dunnad01 462 2379 ## 12 evansda01 414 1410 ## 13 foxxji01 534 1311 ## 14 gehrilo01 493 790 ## 15 giambja01 440 1572 ## 16 gonzaju03 434 1273 ## 17 griffke02 630 1779 ## 18 guerrvl01 449 985 ## 19 jacksre01 563 2597 ## 20 jonesan01 434 1748 ## 21 jonesch06 468 1409 ## 22 killeha01 573 1699 ## 23 kingmda01 442 1816 ## 24 konerpa01 439 1391 ## 25 mantlmi01 536 1710 ## 26 matheed01 512 1487 ## 27 mayswi01 660 1526 ## 28 mccovwi01 521 1550 ## 29 mcgrifr01 493 1882 ## 30 mcgwima01 583 1596 ## 31 murraed02 504 1516 ## 32 musiast01 475 696 ## 33 ortizda01 541 1750 ## 34 ottme01 511 896 ## 35 palmera01 569 1348 ## 36 piazzmi01 427 1113 ## 37 pujolal01 591 1053 ## 38 ramirma02 555 1813 ## 39 ripkeca01 431 1305 ## 40 robinfr02 586 1532 ## 41 rodrial01 696 2287 ## 42 ruthba01 714 1330 ## 43 schmimi01 548 1883 ## 44 sheffga01 509 1171 ## 45 snidedu01 407 1237 ## 46 soriaal01 412 1803 ## 47 sosasa01 609 2306 ## 48 stargwi01 475 1936 ## 49 teixema01 409 1441 ## 50 thomafr04 521 1397 ## 51 thomeji01 612 2548 ## 52 willibi01 426 1046 ## 53 willite01 521 709 ## 54 winfida01 465 1686 ## 55 yastrca01 452 1393 result<-sqldf(query) Now, we can visualize the data in a scatter plot.
